intro: Maesa lutea, commonly known as the yellow maesa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Maesa lutea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky soils.
